result.execSummary:
The defendant LMichael Lamont Borland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges. To be paid at rate of $50 per month commencing 9/15/14.  If a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge if not previously done.  Cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LMichael Lamont Borland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant LMichael Lamont Borland in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 75 days at the House of Correction with Huber for work and 3 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $50 per month commencing 9-15-14 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant LMichael Lamont Borland in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-07-2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, State's Reuested Jury Instructions and Jury Instructions received and filed./ds

Defendant LMichael Lamont Borland in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  William Levins for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Pretrial scheduling order received and file.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant LMichael Lamont Borland in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to suppress proceeds.  On motion of the defense, Court orders witnesses sequestered.  Sworn-in for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Vance Scollin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.   Court finds the defendant was in violation of the ordinance and officer did have probable cause to stop the vehicle and cite the defendant for that violation.  Court denies motion. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion and Motion for Supression of Evidence, filed by Attorney Jeff Schwarz.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Suppression of Evidence received and filed./ds

Defendant LMichael Lamont Borland in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Motions to be filed by 4-11-14; response/reply by 4-21-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant LMichael Lamont Borland in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense needs time to review discovery with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant LMichael Lamont Borland in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  William Levins for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   Court ordered no possession or use of NO DRUGS.

Defendant LMichael Lamont Borland in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
